_comment: Invalid decimal test cases for JSON validation. These values SHOULD FAIL JSON Schema validation or are invalid JSON syntax.
_note: JSON does not allow: leading +, leading/trailing whitespace, .47 syntax, 123. syntax. These would be syntax errors or string values.

test-cases.description: Placeholder - see comments below for invalid cases that cannot be represented in JSON

leading_plus.reason: JSON syntax does not allow leading + on numbers. This would be a parse error.

leading_zeros.reason: JSON syntax does not allow leading zeros on numbers (except 0 itself). This would be a parse error.

no_leading_digit.reason: JSON syntax requires a digit before the decimal point. This would be a parse error.

trailing_decimal.reason: JSON syntax requires digits after the decimal point. This would be a parse error.

leading_whitespace.reason: If represented as a string " 12.34", it would fail type: number validation.

trailing_whitespace.reason: If represented as a string "12.34 ", it would fail type: number validation.
